title: Chicken with Creamy Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce Recipe
description: This creamy sun-dried tomato chicken dish with garlic, white wine, and fresh basil is a wonderful one-pan chicken dinner that's perfect for company.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Meat and Poultry Chicken Chicken Breast Creamy Chicken Chicken with Creamy Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce 4.7 (18) 14 Reviews 3 Photos I love this creamy sun-dried tomato chicken dinner that's wonderful for company. Everything is cooked in one skillet, which makes it even better! Submitted by Cooking44 Updated on November 17, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 3 Prep Time: 20 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 4 pounds boneless skinless chicken breasts salt and pepper to taste 10 tablespoons butter, divided 6 cloves garlic, minced 2 teaspoons Italian seasoning ½ teaspoon red pepper flakes 1 cup dry white wine (such as Chardonnay) 2 cups chicken broth 1 ½ cups heavy whipping cream 1 cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, thinly sliced 1 cup thinly sliced fresh basil Directions Place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag and pound to an even thickness. If breasts are very large, cut them in half. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat and cook 1/2 of the chicken breasts until they are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 5 to 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from skillet and set aside. Melt another 4 tablespoons butter and repeat with the remaining chicken breasts. Set aside. Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in the same skillet and add garlic, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Pour in wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Pour in chicken broth, return to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cream and sun-dried tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in basil and return chicken to the skillet. Cook until chicken is thoroughly heated and sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes. Add Your Photo Photos of Chicken with Creamy Sun-Dried Tomato Sauce 01 of 03 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 03 Photo by  Julie Omnet 02/28/2024 Great flavors A keeper! Easy to follow Yummy and easy! Even my sister who does not know her way around the kitchen could make it. name: Cooking44

Season lightly with salt and pepper.;Melt 4 tablespoons butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat and cook 1/2 of the chicken breasts until they are no longer pink in the center and the juices run clear, 5 to 10 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C). Remove from skillet and set aside. Melt another 4 tablespoons butter and repeat with the remaining chicken breasts. Set aside.;Melt remaining 2 tablespoons butter in the same skillet and add garlic, Italian seasoning, and red pepper flakes. Cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Pour in wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes. Pour in chicken broth, return to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in cream and sun-dried tomatoes. Simmer for 5 minutes.;Stir in basil and return chicken to the skillet. Cook until chicken is thoroughly heated and sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes.
